description: The Department of National Defence is purchasing 200 Breathers, Model FIS-102HPBR-19GR, for CFSD Montreal.
duration_in_months: But the bid is now expired
full_summary:
====================================

**Tender Announcement: Breather - Request for Proposal**
=====================================================

**Reference Number:** cb-7616-84356341

**Procurement Number:** W8485-247691/A

**Publication Date:** July 27, 2023

**Tender Closing Date and Time:** August 24, 2023, 16:00:00

**Expected Contract Start Date:** August 25, 2023

**Expected Contract End Date:** March 29, 2024

**Tender Status:** Expired

**Procurement Description:**

The Department of National Defence invites eligible suppliers to submit proposals for the supply of Breathers, as described below.

**Item Details:**

* Item 1: Breather
* Specification: FIS-102HPBR-19GR
* Quantity: 200
* Unit of Issue: EA
* Delivery Location: 25 CFSD Montreal

**Commercial Terms:**

* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Open bidding
* Selection Criteria: Lowest Price

**Contact Information:**

* Contact Name: Dany Lebel
* Email: dany.lebel2@forces.gc.ca
* Phone: (000) 000-0000

**Document Availability:**

* The Request for Proposal document can be downloaded from the Canada Buys website.

**Submission Requirements:**

* Electronic submissions are strongly encouraged, using the epost Connect service.
* Simultaneously, three (3) copies must be submitted in either official language of Canada, in accordance with the delivery instructions in the Invitation to Bid.

For purposes of this Request for Proposal, a Breather is defined as a respiratory protection product that meets the specifications outlined in the Bid Solicitation document. Suppliers who wish to submit an equivalent or substitute product must indicate the brand name and model, or the Part Number and the NCAGE code they are offering.

**Terms and Conditions:**

The Department of National Defence reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. The Crown retains the rights to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
